top_categories.workout_context: Heywood Ride rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Heywood Ride’s minnesota rolling, local event demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Heywood Ride’s minnesota rolling gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Heywood Ride. Make this intensity feel like home.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Heywood Ride when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Racing Heywood Ride isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Every session at Heywood Ride intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Heywood Ride’s minnesota rolling gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Heywood Ride — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Heywood Ride — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
The varied gradients at Heywood Ride reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
High-volume endurance builds the aerobic base that makes Heywood Ride’s race-day efforts sustainable rather than destructive.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Heywood Ride’s 50 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Heywood Ride requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on minnesota rolling gravel to build confidence. Expect: minnesota rolling, local event, midwest gravel.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Durability to prepare you for 50 miles of minnesota rolling gravel in Northfield, Minnesota.
